thread.title: dna Must Reads for the evening: ISIS destroys monuments, toddler's head reattached, India-Germany and more
thread.title_full: dna Must Reads for the evening: ISIS destroys monuments, toddler's head reattached, India-Germany and more | Latest News & Updates at Daily News & Analysis

author: dna webdesk
title: dna Must Reads for the evening: ISIS destroys monuments, toddler's head reattached, India-Germany and more
text:
dna evening Must Reads dna webdesk Here are some of the must read stories on dnaindia.com for the evening:
1) Toddler's decapitated head reattached to neck after car crash : In a miraculous surgery, doctors in Australia were able to successfully reattach a 16-month-old boy's head to his neck after it was pulled apart in an internal decapitation during a car accident.
2) India, Germany sign 18 MoUs: India and Germany signed a deal on Monday to fast-track business approvals , an arrangement to make it easier for German companies to operate in Asia's third largest economy that was announced as Chancellor Angela Merkel visited New Delhi.
3) ISIS blows up 2,000-year-old Arch of Triumph in Syria's Palmyra: ISIS has already destroyed the shrine of Baal Shamin and the 2,000-year-old Temple of Bel , regarded as Palmyra's masterpiece, as part of a campaign to destroy pre-Islamic monuments, tombs and statues it considers idolatrous.
4) 2015 Nobel prize for medicine: William Campbell, Satoshi Omura and Youyou Tu jointly won the 2015 Nobel Prize for medicine for their work against parasitic diseases, the award-giving body said on Monday.
5) Jet Airways cuts fares by up to 30% on overseas routes: Wooing international flyers ahead of the festive season, private carrier Jet Airways on Monday slashed its business and economy class fares by up to 30% across its global destinations including those in the US and Europe for a limited period.
